addl_comments: set base_date to a business day before the intended start date for the real-time calcs
set base_value to the value of the index on the base_date

[OPTIONAL] bbg_ticker: due to the limitations of the Bloomberg ticker creation process (no API), this must be a pre-created ticker. You can email MerQube a list of tickers to create on your behalf at support@merqube.com. Then, you provide those as input to these indices.
constituents_csv_path - path to a csv file like the constituents.csv in this directory
[OPTIONAL] set level_overrides_path to a csv file like the level_overrides.csv in this directory, if there are specific dates that need to be overridden
set is_intraday to true if the index is to be calculated intraday. Costs more.
set name to the name on Merqube's website for the index. Can also be used for the ticker on Bloomberg. This must be globally unique (you will get a 409 if the name is taken)
set namespace to your organization's namespace for indices
set run_hour and run_minute to the time of day that the index should be calculated, in the timezone specified. Eg 18 and 0 for 6pm
timezone is optional, defaulting to US/Eastern. Must be a valid pytz timezone
